Exports to US rebound in Nov amid supply-chain shifts & holiday restocking: GTRI
description: India's exports to the US rebounded in November after two months of continuous decline. growing by 22.61% to reach $6.98 billion. This was largely driven by upply-chain adjustments and pre-holiday season inventory restocking, according to the Global Trade Research Initiative (GTRI). The trade data shows imports from the US also grew significantly, jumping 38.29 per cent to $5.25 billion during the month.

Pakistan bowlers didn't give away and bowled tight lines from the beginning. Fast bowler Ali Raza took 4 wickets, including Ayush Mhatre, and Vaibhav Sooryavanshi. While Mohammad Sayyam, Abdul Subhan, Huzaifa Ahsan took 2 wickets each.​​

The new law guarantees 125 days of wage employment annually to rural households volunteering for unskilled manual work, aligning with the Viksit Bharat 2047 vision. Opposition parties have criticized the move, citing concerns over undermining Mahatma Gandhi's legacy.

The couple, who welcomed a baby earlier this year, reportedly began dating in June 2023. Brady's song choice, Logic's '1-800-273-8255', has raised questions about his state of mind.

title: Not Bishop or Simon Doull: Fans give pitch report during NZ vs WI Test - Watch
description: Fans offered their opinions on the Mount Maunganui pitch, a role typically for experts, as New Zealand built a commanding lead against the West Indies. Centuries from Latham and Conway bolstered New Zealand's position, setting a challenging target of 462 after bowling out the West Indies for 420 and declaring their second innings at 306/2.

title: Even Rajinikanth and Shah Rukh Khan couldn’t recreate the magic Sreenivasan once achieved in Malayalam with Mammootty
In 6 months, Railways hikes passenger fares again across classes; suburban ticket rates unchanged

Western Railway to commission Jogeshwari as Mumbai’s fourth rail terminus by June 2026
T20 WC squad: Gambhir asked about Gill omission at airport - Watch
description: India revealed its T20 World Cup 2026 squad. Shubman Gill's exclusion surprised many. Ishan Kishan's strong domestic form earned him a spot. Chief selector Ajit Agarkar cited Gill's lack of runs. Captain Suryakumar Yadav emphasized the need for an aggressive opening wicketkeeper. The selection signals a focus on attacking players for the upcoming tournament.

When did Indian Railways last hike passenger fares
San Francisco blackout: Power outage leaves nearly a third of city in darkness
description: San Francisco faced a massive power outage on Saturday, impacting over 124,000 customers and disrupting daily life just before Christmas. A fire at a PG&E substation was identified as the cause, leading to widespread closures of businesses and transit. Power restoration efforts were underway overnight.

title: Kisan Trust’s Chaudhary Charan Singh Awards 2025 honours excellence in agriculture and rural development
U19 Asia Cup: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi fails again; departs cheaply in final
description: Teenage prodigy Vaibhav Sooryavanshi was dismissed for 26 in the U19 Asia Cup final against Pakistan. Pakistan opener Sameer Minhas starred with a brilliant 172, propelling Pakistan to a massive 347/8. India, chasing the steep target, found themselves in deep trouble after early wickets. Sooryavanshi also failed to score big in the semi-final against Sri Lanka.

title: This is what happens to the body when you smoke 2 cigarettes a day for a month
Seven elephants die in train hit in Assam: How such accidents can be prevented
'Huge mistake': Bhagwat on viewing RSS through BJP lens; clarifies objective of outfit
description: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that understanding the Sangh through the BJP lens is a “huge mistake” and stressed that the organisation has no political agenda. Addressing programmes in Kolkata, he said the RSS should not be compared to political or service organisations and works for the betterment and protection of Hindu society, calling for opinions about the Sangh to be based on facts rather than narratives.

title: Accused of carrying cow meat, UP shop owner brutally assaulted; 2 arrested

B'desh unrest: India rebuts Dhaka media's 'propaganda'; flags atrocities against minorities
description: India has dismissed Bangladeshi media reports as "misleading propaganda" regarding a protest outside its High Commission in New Delhi. The demonstration, involving a small group, protested the killing of a minority member in Mymensingh. India is monitoring the situation in Bangladesh and has conveyed strong concerns over minority atrocities, urging justice for the victim.

title: Bezos' ex-wife's charity: Biggest annual donation of $7.1B in 2025; Amazon stake halved
description: MacKenzie Scott donated over $7.1 billion in 2025 to 186 organizations globally, including universities and environmental nonprofits. This marks her largest annual giveaway, with significant contributions to diversity and equity initiatives like Howard University and college access programs. Scott has also reduced her Amazon stake by $12.6 billion.

MAHA TET 2025: Provisional answer keys out at mahatet.in for paper 1, 2
How the Indian education system is responding to high AQI and cold waves
description: North Indian schools are adapting to winter challenges, with hazardous air quality and cold waves forcing changes. Delhi-NCR schools are shifting to online and hybrid models under GRAP IV. Uttar Pradesh districts are closing schools due to fog and cold, while Bihar is revising timings to safeguard students. These measures prioritize health amidst extreme weather.

Mountains older than memory: How new 'definition' of Aravalli risks eroding 'Viksit Bharat'
description: India's ancient Aravalli Range faces a new definition crisis after a Supreme Court ruling.  The court accepted a 100-meter elevation threshold for identifying the hills, sparking concerns among environmentalists. Critics argue this narrow view ignores the range's vital ecological functions, potentially opening it to unchecked mining and real estate development, threatening water security and climate stability.

Train travel gets costlier: Here is how much your ticket will cost now
description: Indian Railways will implement a revised fare structure from December 26 to address rising operational and manpower costs. Passengers traveling beyond 215 km in Ordinary Class will see a 1 paise per kilometer increase, while Mail and Express non-AC and AC coaches will face a 2 paise per kilometer hike. Suburban and monthly season tickets remain unchanged.

Brittany Mahomes silent as Randi shares hope amid Patrick Mahomes recovery
description: Patrick Mahomes’ season-ending knee injury has left the Chiefs in unfamiliar territory. While Brittany Mahomes has remained silent, his mother Randi publicly thanked fans for their prayers and support. As Mahomes begins a lengthy rehabilitation, the Chiefs face a rare playoff miss but remain optimistic about his full recovery and return in 2026.

title: Messi got Rs 89cr for India tour, govt Rs 11cr as tax: Organiser blames ‘influential' people
description: Event organizer Satadru Dutta was arrested following chaos during the Messi tour in Kolkata. Police seized Rs 22 crore from his accounts, suspecting black money use. Dutta claimed Rs 100 crore was spent, but investigators doubt his financial figures. He also blamed others for the event's disorder, citing pressures for increased access.

title: Pay to meet Tihar inmates: Operators' role under lens over illegal mulakat charges
description: A racket charging relatives for legally free inmate meetings at Tihar Jail has been exposed. An inmate's tip-off led to an investigation where undercover officials were asked for money. As a precaution, 20-25 data entry operators were transferred while the probe into touts and system misuse continues. Biometric authentication is being introduced to enhance security.

title: 4th elephant death on rail tracks this year, toll rises to 94 since 2019
Lakers vs Clippers (Dec 20): Preview, lineups, injury report and how to watch
description: The Los Angeles Lakers, with a strong 19-7 record and recent offensive surge, face the struggling Los Angeles Clippers (6-21) tonight. The Lakers have been dominant since mid-November, especially with LeBron James healthy, while the Clippers are on an eight-game home losing streak. Luka Doncic led the Lakers to a season-high 143 points in their last outing.

title: 'Recovery isn’t optional': Why Chiefs Heiress Gracie hunt chose strength in 2025
description: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt reveals she gained 15 lbs during her 2025 fitness journey, explaining why strength, recovery, and long-term health mattered more than appearance. The Kansas City Chiefs owner’s daughter shares how intentional training, muscle gain, and consistency helped her finish the year stronger than she started.

title: Anthony Joshua net worth 2025: Boxing earnings, career and Jake Paul fight payday
description: Anthony Joshua's net worth is estimated at £195 million in 2025, with the majority earned from boxing purses. He also generates significant income from endorsements and property investments. Joshua is set to earn a guaranteed £70 million from his upcoming fight against Jake Paul, a professionally sanctioned eight-round heavyweight bout.

title: Meta’s AI chief unhappy: Wang calls Zuckerberg ‘suffocating’; makes micromanagement claims
description: Meta's $14.8 billion investment in Scale AI and the integration of its CEO, Alexandr Wang, into a new "superintelligence" lab are reportedly facing internal friction. Wang allegedly finds Mark Zuckerberg's micromanagement "suffocating," while some staff question Wang's experience. This shift also clashes with Meta's open-source AI philosophy, leading to executive departures.
